intro: Trigonella velutinoides, commonly known as velvet senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
